page.title: 01INTRODUCTION.
page.content: The area we have studied can be divided into three regions. Firstly the pre Second World War residential streets of terraced houses on the fringe ofthe town centre. Secondly post war housing estates,both council and privately owned, on the outskirts of the town. These estates have their own self contained shopping precincts and usual neighbourhood services such as youth and community centres as well as schools. Thirdly the north west and most northerly areas are basically agricultural land with a more rural land use. The whole area forms the outskirts of the main township of Stockton-on- Tees, leading out to the rural settlements of south Durham.
